title: Ensure Play button reliably starts 90s dance background music

requirements.text: Ensure that pressing the floating Play button starts playback of the bundled 90s dance background music track using the existing audio path "/assets/audio/background-dance.mp3", and that the UI correctly reflects the playing state immediately after a successful start (switching from Play to the mute/volume controls).

quotes: Wenn ich den Play button drücke soll dance musik aus den 90s starten

acceptanceCriteria: On a first-time visit (no prior opt-in), the site does not autoplay music and shows the Play button.
Clicking the Play button starts audio playback of /assets/audio/background-dance.mp3 (looping) and the UI switches to the mute/volume controls.
After a page reload (with opt-in stored), music either plays automatically or, if blocked by browser policy, starts upon the next user interaction per the existing unblock logic.
The existing mute/unmute and volume persistence behavior continues to work as before.

requirements.text: If playback cannot be started after the user presses the Play button (e.g., browser blocks playback or the audio asset fails to load), show a clear user-facing error message in English while keeping the page usable and leaving the Play button available for retry.

quotes: Wenn ich den Play button drücke soll dance musik aus den 90s starten

acceptanceCriteria: When userInitiatedPlay() fails, the UI shows an English message indicating music could not be started and suggests trying again.
The Play button remains visible/usable so the user can retry starting music.
No console error causes React rendering to break (page remains usable).

constraints: Keep the background music asset path unchanged: /assets/audio/background-dance.mp3.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding additional music tracks, a playlist, or a track selector.
Changing the overall presale page layout/sections unrelated to background music.
